definition[0]: if an idea, feeling, or piece of information percolates through a group, it gradually spreads
example[0]: These ideas were slow to percolate.
example[1]: The message has begun to percolate through the organization.
definition[1]: if liquid, light, or air percolates somewhere, it passes slowly through a material that has very small holes in it
example[2]: Rainwater percolates down through the rock.
definition[2]: if coffee percolates, or if you percolate it, you make it in a special pot in which hot water goes up through a tube and then passes down through crushed coffee beans
